text: make sure you have the amplify CLI
installed and authorized there's a link
in the description on how to do this now
head to the studio and click on local
setup instructions copy the pull command
and run it in your terminal to pull both
the components data model and some
amplify settings
you will be redirected to the browser to
authorize the pull request
click yes to continue
and head back to the terminal afterwards
amplify will ask you a few questions to
understand your project better so it
knows where to pull the files to
choose your editor
choose JavaScript as the language
just react as the framework
since it's in next project the root
directory is the source directory the
dot next folder is the build directory
the build command is npm run build and
the start command is npm run Dev lastly
answer yes to be able to modify the back
end
now back to the editor you should see
that we now have a few new files and
folders most importantly we have the UI
component folder which contains the
react code for each of the components we
had in figma
you can see we have the hero component
the nav component among other components
and we are pulling them all together and
re-exporting them in the index.js file
the changes we made the same are stored
in the studio theme.js file
spotted as a Json object open the app.js
file and import amplify
import the theme file
import the amplify provider
pause the reset CSS file
import the amplify UI kit Styles and
lastly import the interfont wrap the app
tree with the provider and pass the
studio theme object to the provider when
we pulled amplify also pulled our config
settings we need to configure amplify
with this settings in the app.js file
import the config object and call
amplify.configure and pass it to the
configuration open the index.js page
from the pages folder
delete everything in the folder and
create a basic component
let's try one of the components we
created import the hero component from
the UI components folder and import The
View component
a view component is basically a Dave
wrapper render The View component and
render the hero component inside it then
head to the browser and you should see
the rendered hero component
